revised_title: Examining Individual Protein Turnover and Growth Efficiency in Rainbow Trout
tldr: This study investigates the relationship between consumption, growth, and protein synthesis in individual rainbow trout held in groups. The research found that fractional rates of protein growth and synthesis increased with consumption rate, while degradation rates were independent of consumption. More efficient fish had reduced degradation rates, which could explain the observed differences in protein growth efficiency. The results support the hypothesis that individual differences in protein turnover are important determinants of growth efficiency in fish.
